summary: This document is an email chain from December 2018 between SDNY prosecutors discussing a 2016 meeting with attorney Peter Skinner regarding Jeffrey Epstein. It references the sharing of case documents, including a redacted FBI 302, and mentions media reports about Epstein's continued relationships with young women.

persons.name: Kurland, Abigail
persons.context: SDNY prosecutor involved in email correspondence about obtaining notes and records from a meeting with Peter Skinner regarding the Epstein case.

persons.name: Kramer, Amanda
persons.context: SDNY prosecutor who is asked to provide notes and records from her meeting with attorney Peter Skinner regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Peter Skinner
persons.context: Attorney who met with SDNY prosecutors in 2016, provided case documents including a redacted FBI 302, and forwarded a 2016 media report about Epstein's relationships with young women.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Described as one of the lead attorneys on the case, added to an email chain by Peter Skinner in 2016 for follow-up regarding Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the case; the email chain discusses obtaining information about him, and a forwarded article reports on his continued relationships with young women.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to a defamation case against her; a motion to dismiss in that case was denied.

persons.name: Stan Pottinger
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (cc) on a 2016 email from Peter Skinner providing case documents.

persons.name: Brad
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (cc) on a 2016 email from Peter Skinner providing case documents.

connections.description: Skinner adds McCawley to an email chain, identifying her as a lead attorney on the case who knows the facts well.
Skinner met with prosecutor Amanda Kramer and provided her with case documents regarding Epstein.
McCawley is described as a lead attorney on the case involving Epstein.
Maxwell is the subject of a defamation case mentioned in the context of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: PageSix reports on Epstein's relationships
events.description: The PageSix media outlet reports on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women, specifically mentioning his East Side mansion housing 'Russian playmates'.

events.title: Meeting between Skinner and SDNY
events.description: Attorney Peter Skinner meets with SDNY prosecutors (including Amanda Kramer) and follows up by email, providing several case documents.

events.title: Judge Sweet denies Maxwell's motion
events.description: Judge Sweet denies Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss in a defamation case against her.

events.title: SDNY prosecutors seek meeting notes
events.description: SDNY prosecutors correspond internally to obtain notes and records from a 2016 meeting with attorney Peter Skinner regarding the Epstein case.

keyFacts: In December 2018, SDNY prosecutors were actively gathering historical information, specifically seeking notes from a 2016 meeting with attorney Peter Skinner regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
Attorney Peter Skinner provided SDNY with several key documents in 2016, including a redacted FBI 302 form, declarations from a CVRA case, and a Rule 56.1 statement.
A 2016 media report from PageSix, forwarded by Skinner, highlighted Epstein's continued relationships with young women, suggesting ongoing public and investigative interest in his activities.
The email chain confirms coordination between private attorneys (Skinner, McCawley) and federal prosecutors in the investigation of Epstein years before his 2019 arrest.
